summary: The First Responders Wellness Act aims to increase access to mental health and substance use services for first responders.  It mandates a national hotline providing peer support, information, and referrals, with specific requirements for staffing and operation.  The bill also revises the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to include crisis counseling for emergency responders during major disasters and requires a report on best practices for mobile health care delivery in disaster areas.
